title: Quantitative Developer
description:
**Location:** London

**Length:** 6 Months


**PAYE only**

**Overall purpose of the role**


The purpose of the role will be to align BFR’s architecture to the MACRO Intraday Risk strategy, whose objective is to create a scalable enterprise componetised architecture across risk calculation, risk aggregation, post processing (BRisk) and user interaction (BRIsk).


Such an architecture facilitates the aggregation of risk from multiple sources, as well as provides for a de-coupled stable scalable framework to deal with Markets requirements. The current BFR architecture carries out all the above calculations interlaced within its architecture, and the purpose of the role is to simplify BFR to focus solely on Risk Calculations in the most efficient, stable and performant way.


The role and responsibilities will include (but not limited to), a review of all components within BFR, de-coupling of all post-processing aspects from the flow of risk calculations (such as jacobian transforms, aggregations) , replacement of the current Coherence cache as the operational store with a Redis store & re-use of the BOR EOD calculator as the intraday calculation engine. Whilst this is a C++ development role, we are looking for someone who is comfortable across a number of technologies, including C# and Java.

**Key Accountabilities:**

* Review of the flow of BFR’s internal component architecture
* Establish the most efficient way to re-use the intraday components coupled whilst invoking the EOD BOR API for risk calculations.
* Ensuring that software designs are well documented and shared appropriately across the whole team
* Ensuring high code quality and unit test coverage
* Driving continuous improvement of processes
* Regular and frequent reporting on progress
* Ensuring adherence to technical standards & SDLC including quality measures

 **Key Skills:**

* Strong C++ and general programming skills
